songs.title: Alphabet Aerobics

description.plain:
“Alphabet Aerobics” is the most popular track off Blackalicious‘ 1999 EP A2G. It features Gift of Gab tearing up a simple beat (provided by Cut Chemist rather than Blackalicious’ usual producer, Chief Xcel) with gradually building pace.

The track is performed so that every couplet is filled with words starting with a specific letter. Every two lines moves to the next letter of the alphabet, however by the letter “Y”, he becomes nearly indecipherable. This is called alliteration for consonants and assonance for vowels.



This track was brought into the spotlight once more on October 28th, 2014 when Daniel Radcliffe (most popular for his role as Harry Potter) performed the entire song flawlessly on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.

That video can be seen below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aKdV5FvXLuI

songs.title: Make You Feel That Way

description.plain:
This entire song is a list of things that make you feel good, and is a part of Blackalicious' ongoing theme of countering negativity often found in rap music and urban culture in general.

The music video can be found here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wIGJ1lekcMg

songs.full_title: Release by Blackalicious (Ft. Lyrics Born & Saul Williams)
songs.title: Release

description.plain:
In this song – technically titled “Release Parts 1, 2, & 3” – different modes of release are explored in three movements. First, Gift of Gab (and Zach De La Rocha from Rage Against the Machine) vent their frustration with sub-par rappers

Then Saul Williams suggests becoming more centered by releasing your mental and spiritual chains through meditation

Finally, Lyrics Born suggests you release the control over your life of others' selfish pessimism by excelling in a way that silences their criticism

Gift of Gab then concludes by proving Lyrics Born’s point: he releases a lyrical torrent book-ended by an empowering chorus about taking personal responsibility for and control of your life

songs.title: Deception

description.plain: “Deception” is about the rise and fall of a young rapper’s career, all because he was drawn to money. It is the fourth song of Blackalicious' 1999 debut album “Nia”. The track samples the 1973 song “Burnin' Love” by Black Grass.

songs.full_title: First in Flight by Blackalicious (Ft. Gil Scott-Heron)
songs.title: First in Flight

description.plain:
This song could be seen as an opposite to the song right before it on Blazing Arrow called “Sky Is Falling.” Not to mention their titles are opposites as well.

Whereas “Sky Is Falling” has a very negative vibe and talks about the mistreatment and struggle of the black community, “First in Flight” has a very positive, “everything is going to be okay” message. Gift of Gab raps about raising up, being free, and being happy. Gil Scott-Heron, a legendary poet/civil rights activist, is sampled throughout the song.

songs.title: Shallow Days

description.plain: This song is about how shallow most rap and hip hop music is today, and how we should be careful what we say because it influences people’s behaviour, especially children.

songs.title: Sky is Falling

description.plain:
The Hook of this song describes apocalyptic type events and after Gift of Gab raps about the horrible treatment the government (cops) has had and continues to have towards African-Americans in U.S history. You see then that he is saying that this treatment feels like the end of the world or like the “Sky Is Falling”

But in the second verse Gift of Gab criticizes the role the Emcee or Rapper has in these communities. He says that emcees, such as himself, aren’t doing enough to better the African-American community and instead focus on the negative aspect like joining gangs, robbing, killing etc.

songs.embed_content: Read “Sky is Falling” by Blackalicious on Genius
